conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a roof-off 3D cutaway with extruded walls (height/thickness visible) and an elevated, slightly angled viewpoint showing side faces and interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall extrusion with thickness and readable room volumes; cutaway is clean. View is only mildly angled (close to top-down), limiting side-surface visibility and reducing spatial depth cues.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches: central living/dining, kitchen/utility zone, and four bedroom blocks are present with broadly correct adjacencies. Some proportional/shape deviations are visible (especially around the top deck/corridor geometry and some partition offsets). Doors/windows are simplified and not consistently verifiable against the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture exists in expected rooms (beds in bedrooms, sofa/coffee table in living, dining table, kitchen counters). Bathrooms/fixtures are present but simplified; some rooms lack detailed fixture alignment.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors are distinguishable and presentation is clean, but the render is slightly blurry/low-contrast, making openings (doors/windows) and fine partitions harder to confirm.

detected_errors.description: Minor-to-moderate proportional/layout deviations versus the 2D plan (notably around the top deck/terrace outline and some internal partition placements).
Doors/windows are not clearly represented or are too simplified to confirm correct wall placement and swing/orientation.
Render softness/low detail reduces geometric readability of openings and small wall segments.

summary: This is a valid roof-off 3D conversion with broadly faithful room layout and furnishings, but with some proportional/partition drift and insufficiently verifiable door/window placement.
